markdown.markdown: ```{css, echo=FALSE} .quarto-title { display: none; } ``` ```{r} #| out.width: 100% knitr::include_graphics('images/courses_banner.jpg') ``` List of current and previous courses taught at Brooklyn College of CUNY and the Graduate Center of CUNY. # Fall 2022 ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ## [Psyc 2530 Introduction to Cognitive Psychology](https://crumplab.github.io/cognition/) Brooklyn College of CUNY, Undergraduate, Psychology The [course website](https://crumplab.github.io/cognition/) contains syllabus, textbook, slide decks and more. [![License: CC BY-SA 4.0](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-CC%20BY--SA%204.0-lightgrey.svg)](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/) ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ```{r 2530_Fall_2022, out.width=150, echo=F} knitr::include_graphics("images/2530_image.jpg") ``` ::: ::: # Past courses Some of these courses have open materials, older courses may not. ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ## [Psyc 2530 Introduction to Cognitive Psychology (Asynchronous online)](https://crumplab.github.io/cognition/) Spring 2022, Brooklyn College of CUNY, Undergraduate, Psychology, Asynchronous online The [course website](https://crumplab.github.io/cognition/) contains syllabus, textbook, slide decks and more. [![License: CC BY-SA 4.0](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-CC%20BY--SA%204.0-lightgrey.svg)](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/) ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ```{r 2530_2022, out.width=150, echo=F} knitr::include_graphics("images/2530_image.jpg") ``` ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ## [Psyc 7709G - Using R for Reproducible research](https://crumplab.github.io/rstatsmethods/) Spring 2022, Brooklyn College of CUNY, Experimental Psychology MA program [Course website](https://crumplab.github.io/rstatsmethods/) contains syllabus and readings. ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ```{r r7709G2022, out.width=150, echo=F} knitr::include_graphics("images/RStudio.png") ``` ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ## Psyc 2530 Introduction to Cognitive Psychology, Fall 2021 Brooklyn College of CUNY, Undergraduate, Psychology All materials for Fall 2021 are stored as a branch in the github repository for this course . ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ```{r 2530, out.width=150, echo=F} knitr::include_graphics("images/2530_image.jpg") ``` ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ## Psyc 7765/66G - Statistical Methods Applications I 2020-2021, Brooklyn College of CUNY, Master's, Experimental Psychology The [course website](https://crumplab.github.io/rstatsmethods/) contains syllabus and readings. ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ```{r stats7765, out.width=150, echo=F} knitr::include_graphics("images/psyc7765.png") ``` ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ## Psyc 73800 - Cognitive Psychology 2020, 2021, Graduate Center of CUNY, Doctoral, Cognitive and Comparative Psychology Training (CCP) area Bi-weekly modules taught by different faculty. The [course website](https://crumplab.github.io/psyc73800/) contains syllabus and readings. ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ```{r cogsci2021, out.width=200, echo=F} knitr::include_graphics("images/cognitive_science.png") ``` ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ## Psyc 7709G - Statistical Methods Practicum II Brooklyn College of CUNY The [course website](https://crumplab.github.io/psyc7709Lab/) contains syllabus and readings. ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ```{r statsLab2, out.width=150, echo=F} knitr::include_graphics("images/logo2statsII.png") ``` ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ## Psyc 73800 - Cognitive Psychology Graduate Center of CUNY Bi-weekly modules taught by different faculty. The [course website](https://crumplab.github.io/psyc73800/) contains syllabus and readings. ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ```{r cogsci2020, out.width=200, echo=F} knitr::include_graphics("images/cognitive_science.png") ``` ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ## Psyc 7709G - Statistical Methods Practicum I Brooklyn College of CUNY The [course website](https://crumplab.github.io/psyc7709Lab/) contains syllabus and readings. ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ```{r statsLab, out.width=150, echo=F} knitr::include_graphics("images/Psyc7709G.png") ``` ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ## Psyc 7709: Using R for reproducible research This is a special topics course for the Experimental Psychology Master's program. The course website is ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ```{r rcourse, out.width=150, echo=F} knitr::include_graphics("images/Rstudio.png") ``` ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ## Psyc 3400: Statistical Methods in Psychological Research All materials are totally free and open, including the [course Website](https://crumplab.github.io/psyc3400/), [textbook](https://crumplab.github.io/statistics/), and [lab manual](https://crumplab.github.io/statisticsLab/). ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ```{r statsTextbook, out.width=150, echo=F} knitr::include_graphics("images/TextbookCover.png") ``` ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ## Psyc 73800 - Cognitive Psychology Fall 2018 (2017) \@ Graduate Center of CUNY Bi-weekly modules taught by different faculty. The [course website](https://crumplab.github.io/psyc73800/) contains syllabus and readings. ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ```{r cogsci, out.width=200, echo=F} knitr::include_graphics("images/cognitive_science.png") ``` ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ## Psyc 80103: Cognitive Technologies: From theory and data to application Spring 2018 \@ Graduate Center of CUNY A doctoral seminar course (special topics) covering emerging and old cognitive technologies. Check out the [course website](https://crumplab.github.io/cognitivetechnologies), or [read the book](https://crumplab.github.io/cognitivetechnologies/book/) we wrote on the topic (students in the course wrote the chapters). ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ```{r cogTech, out.width=150, echo=F} knitr::include_graphics("images/CogTech.png") ``` ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ## Psyc 3450: Experimental Psychology Fall 2017 (2016, 2015, 2013, 2012, 2011) \@ Brooklyn College An undergraduate course on research methods, using a free OER textbook! Written by myself and many others. Check out the [textbook here](https://crumplab.github.io/ResearchMethods/). Check out the [course website here](https://crumplab.github.io/psyc3450/). ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ```{r researchmeth, out.width=150, echo=F} knitr::include_graphics("images/ResearchMethods.png") ``` ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ## Psyc 80103: Computer Programming for Psychologists \@ Brooklyn College I put my lecture notes into a [book](https://crumplab.github.io/programmingforpsych/) (covers R, Livecode and a bit of web programming.) ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ```{r programming, out.width=150, echo=F} knitr::include_graphics("images/Programming.png") ``` ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ## Psyc 3530 : Introduction to Cognitive Psychology \@ Brooklyn College ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ## Psyc 80103 : Special Topics Seminar: Learning & Attention Special topics doctoral course \@ GC Co-taught with Andrew Delamater ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ## Psyc 80103 : Special Topics: Memory: Foundations & Current Issues Special topics doctoral course \@ GC Co-taught with Elizabeth Chua ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ## Psyc 80103 : Career Development Doctoral course \@ GC Co-taught with Elizabeth Chua
